alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 8:47PM EDT until July 08 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL DELAWARE COUNTY... At 847 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Swarthmore, Broomall, Newtown Square, Trout Lake, Drexel Hill, Nether Providence Township, Radnor Township, Bryn Mawr, Lima, Lansdowne, and Clifton Heights. This includes the following highways... Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 3 and 12. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
